main event: A UFO sighting was reported on December 3, 1957 in Tampa, Florida. The observation lasted for 45 seconds, during which a civilian witnessed two white lights, a flashing green light to the rear, and a 250-foot long, 120-foot wide object making a night landing.
interesting points: The object had characteristics of an aircraft, and the sound of motors was noted, possibly from another source.
There were no photographs included in the report.
The report mentioned a doughnut-shaped propeller in the center of a plexiglass dome, with three men sitting inside, and a Hodge jet engine mounted on the central doughnut.
A sketch of the object by an eyewitness was included in the report.
Smoke was reported coming from two engines, which were noted to be similar to a jet but not the same.
result: The report suggests that the object could have been an actual helicopter observed under poor sighting conditions, or an unidentified sighting.
sighted object: A 250-foot long, 120-foot wide object with two white lights and a flashing green light to the rear
